body_html: @fmassa, yes it was to fix a performance issue: Tensors (including 0d) are sent across processes differently from Python numbers. Python numbers are simply encode and written to the Queue/Pipe, which is very quick. For tensors, we mmap a shared memory page, copy the data to the shared memory, and then encode a handle to the Queue/Pipe. This has much higher overhead than the Python number encoding.
